article.headline: Trump coronavirus symptoms âresolving and improving,â doctor says
article.body: President Donald Trumpâs symptoms are âresolving and improvingâ, his physician said Saturday, and he said doctors were âextremely happyâ with the presidentâs progress, after news early Friday that Trump had COVID-19. âThe team and I are extremely happy with the progress the president has made,â said Dr. Sean Conley at Walter Reed Medical Center in Bethesda, Md., where the president is staying. âHe had a mild cough and nasal congestion and fatigue, all of which are now resolving and improving,â said Conley. Conley said that Trump had no fever for 24 hours and that the president was not currently on oxygen. But he did not say whether Trump had ever been on oxygen despite reportersâ repeated questions. Trump said early Friday that he and first lady Melania Trump had tested positive. Yet Conleyâs briefing raised questions about when the diagnosis was known and disclosed. Doctors said it had been 72 hours since Trumpâs diagnosis. U.S. stocks DJIA, +0.56% Â SPX, +0.87% Â COMP, +1.39% Â ended lower Friday in choppy trade as investors reacted to the Trump news and a weaker-than-expected September jobs report. Trump tweeted late Friday, âGoing well, I think!â The presidentâs diagnosis immediately scrambled the White House presidential campaign, with about a month remaining until Election Day. Trumpâs campaign manager Bill Stepien got a positive COVID-19 diagnosis Friday night. See:Trump campaign manager Stepien, ex-aide Conway are latest in presidentâs orbit to test positive for coronavirus. Others in Trumpâs circle, including ex-aide Kellyanne Conway, tested positive after attending a Sept. 26 Rose Garden ceremony for Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett. Several others who attended the event have also tested positive, including Sens. Mike Lee and Thom Tillis.
